message.content:
{"id": "3666", 
"title": "Bug 3666 Code Completion: Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)", 
"description": "Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the IDE is eating too much code. This issue can be reproduced by following the steps below:

1. Open the provided class.
2. In the 'bar' method, add a parameter to the 'baz' call, so it becomes 'baz(x.foo(), )'.
3. Place the cursor after the first 'x.', then press Ctrl+Space to bring up code assist.
4. Type 'f' to filter the list and select 'foo()'.

The expected behavior is that the code assist should provide 'baz(x.foo())', but it actually provides 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())'.", 
"OB": "When using the code assist feature after typing 'x.foo()', it should suggest 'baz(x.foo())', replacing the current code. Instead, it suggests 'baz(x.foo()x.foo())'. This behavior is incorrect.", 
"EB": "The code assist should suggest 'baz(x.foo())', replacing the current code in the 'bar' method.", 
"SR": "Change the 'baz' call in the 'bar' method to 'baz(x.x.foo())', place the cursor after the first 'x.', press Ctrl+Space, type 'f' to filter the list, and select 'foo()'."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3666', 'title': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletion  Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)', 'description': 'Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add aparameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the codeassist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to controlthe amount of source to replace. Removing codeassist option. ', 'OB': 'The code is changed to:baz(x.foo().foo())I would rather it gave mebaz(x.foo()x.foo())public class X {void bar(X x) {baz(x.foo());}int foo() {return 5;}void baz(int i, int j) {}}KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM)The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.Moved to ITPJCORE.PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM)Option was added.PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM)Removing option. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Change the baz call tobaz(x.x.foo())2. Place the cursor after the first "x."3. CtrlSpace to bring up code assist4. Type "f" to filter the list.5. Select, "foo()"6. '}
